section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Prisoners (Release under Supervision) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: applicant (申請人) means a person who has applied under section 6 of the Ordinance for an order for his release from imprisonment or under section 12(1) or 16(1) for a review;
chairman (主席) means the person serving as chairman of the Board under section 3(a) of the Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Board shall meet as often as is necessary, and at such times and places as the chairman may appoint, for the purposes of considering the cases of applicants.
At meetings of the Board 3 members of the Board shall form a quorum.
The chairman shall preside at meetings of the Board, and if the chairman is absent the members present shall appoint from among themselves a member to preside at that meeting.
Before it considers an applicant’s case the Board shall inform him in writing that he has the right to make written representations to the Board within such time as the Board may specify.
Any representations made under this regulation by an applicant shall be considered by the Board when considering his case.
Where the Board so directs, and the applicant consents, a member of the Board designated by the Board may interview an applicant.

After the applicant is interviewed he shall be given an opportunity within such time as the Board may specify to make any written representations, in addition to any earlier representations that he may have made, which he wishes to be considered by the Board.
A member of the Board who has interviewed an applicant shall make a report of the interview in writing to the Board.
A report on the applicant made under paragraph (3) shall be considered by the Board when it considers his case.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Matters to be considered by the Board
section.content: When considering an applicant’s case the Board shall give effect to the matters mentioned in the First Schedule and shall have regard to such other matters as in the opinion of the Board are relevant to the case.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Conditions of a supervision order
section.content: Conditions that may, under section 7(3) of the Ordinance, be specified for inclusion in a supervision order may relate to matters referred to in the Second Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Reports of the Board
section.text: Where the Board recommends release under supervision under the Ordinance the Board shall when so recommending provide a written report, and a copy of any report made under regulation 5(3), to the Chief Executive.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Forms
section.content: Supervision orders, and orders for the reimprisonment of persons pursuant to section 14(4) of the Ordinance, shall be in such form as the Commissioner may specify.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Matters to be Considered by the Board

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: No applicant shall be recommended for release from imprisonment under the Ordinance unless the Board has had the opportunity to examine the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any report that was prepared for the court of trial to assist the trial judge or magistrate, as the case may be, in determining sentence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any recorded observations of the trial judge or magistrate, as the case may be, in passing sentence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any medical reports on the applicant that are available to the Board;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any report and recommendation which the Commissioner of Police has made for the Board.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: In determining whether to make a recommendation that an applicant should be released under supervision under the Ordinance the Board, in addition to any other matters which it considers relevant to its deliberations, shall consider the following in relation to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the adequacy of supervision available for his supervision order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his ability and readiness to assume obligations and to undertake responsibilities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: his intelligence and training;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: his family circumstances;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: his associates before imprisonment;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: where he proposes to reside on release from imprisonment;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any history of the use by him of drugs, or of involvement by him with any person who holds a criminal record;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: his criminal record;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: his conduct in prison;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: his attitude towards authority and the law; and

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: his conduct during any previous period of probation, care, supervision or licence.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: No applicant shall be recommended for release under supervision under the Ordinance if the Board concludes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is unlikely that he will comply with the conditions of his supervision order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a supervision order in respect of the applicant would be inappropriate having regard to the gravity of the offence for which the applicant was sentenced to imprisonment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: continuing correctional treatment, medical care, or vocational or other training in an institution of the Correctional Services Department would substantially enhance the capacity of the applicant to lead a law-abiding life if he were released at a later date.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Conditions of a Supervision Order
schedule.leadIn: Conditions in a supervision order may include conditions relating to the applicant’s—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reporting requirements under the order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: financial responsibilities towards his dependants;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: employment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: place of residence;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: remaining within any geographical area;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: attendance for medical treatment;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: refraining from associating with persons who have a criminal record or who have any connection with the offence for which he was sentenced;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: refraining from visiting any place connected with the offence for which he was sentenced; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: contributions (if any) for food and accommodation in a hostel.
